info.title: Subjects API
info.description: This is the api specifications for all things related to subjects.

date.description: The date this study event took place

get.description: Get all study procedures for a study event

completed.description: The task being completed or not

admin.description: Whether the contributor is an admin

first_name.description: The first name of the contributor

last_name.description: The last name of the contributor

message.example: Bad request. Missing or invalid input parameters.

required.description: Whether the role definition is required
Whether the role definition is required

contributors.description: The contributors of the role definition

StudyEvent.description: A scheduled event for a subject

display_name.description: The display name of the event

study_arm.description: The study arm of the event

study_event_type.description: The study event type of the event

display_name.description: The display name of the procedure

role_definitions.description: The role definitions of the procedure

locked.description: where the study procedure is locked

version_number.description: The version number of the protocol

current_study_event.description: The study event the subject is currently in

last_name.description: The last name of the user

BadRequest.description: Bad request. Missing or invalid input parameters.

Conflict.description: Conflict. The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the resource.

Forbidden.description: Forbidden. The request was valid, but the server is refusing action.

error.example: You do not have sufficient permission to perform this action
enum: You do not have sufficient permission to perform this action
You cannot perform this action because the study procedure is locked

InternalServerError.description: Internal server error. Please contact support.

NotFound.description: Not found. The requested resource was not found.

Unauthorized.description: Unauthorized. Missing or invalid authentication credentials.
